docs.lead_paragraph: With divisions over health care legislation creating bad blood in the Senate, Senator Roland W. Burris, Democrat of Illinois, went to the floor on Tuesday morning with a poetic offering. ''I recognize the long hours and tense negotiation have left some nerves and tempers frayed,'' Mr. Burris, right, said in his windup. ''I see no reason why we can't share good cheer with one another right here in Washington. So in the spirits of the season, I would like to share my own version of a classic holiday story with my good friends on both sides of the aisle.''
docs.abstract: Sen Roland Burris, Democrat of Illinois, offers parody of classic Christmas poem on Senate floor as divisions over health care legislation continue; photo (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Ben Nelson, Democrat of Nebraska, may have taught his Congressional colleagues a valuable lesson when he clinched a special deal for his state. But not all of them are happy about it. Mr. Nelson, above, bargained for extra payments for his state in negotiations late last week, and then provided Senate Democrats with the 60th vote they needed to advance their health care bill.
docs.abstract: Attorney generals of South Carolina and six other states are examining special deal made by Nebraska Sen Ben Nelson in providing Senate Democrats 60th vote needed to advance their health care bill; photos (S)
docs.snippet: Senator Ben Nelson, Democrat of Nebraska, may have taught his Congressional colleagues a valuable lesson when he clinched a special deal for his state. But not all of them are happy about it.      Mr. Nelson, above, bargained for extra payments for...

docs.lead_paragraph: It's official: No Hawaii for President Obama until the Senate finishes its health care legislation this week. ''I will not leave until my friends in the Senate have completed their work,'' Mr. Obama told reporters Tuesday after meeting with a group of bankers. ''My attitude is, if they are making these sacrifices to provide health care to all Americans, the least I can do is be around and provide them any encouragement and last-minute help.''
docs.abstract: Pres Obama, saying he will stay in Washington (DC) until Senate completes work on health care reform bill, delays Hawaiian vacation (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate voted 60-39 on three steps leading up to a final vote Thursday morning on sweeping health care legislation.

headline.main: Lead-Up to the Final Health Care Vote

docs.snippet: The Senate voted 60-39 on three steps leading up to a final vote Thursday morning on sweeping health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The anticipation of a Christmas Eve vote on a major Senate bill seems to touch the poet's heart in many a Washington pol and wonk.

headline.main: Health Care Doggerel: A Reader Contest

docs.abstract: Prescriptions invites readers to write a better health care parody of "The Night Before Christmas" than the people in Washington seem capable of.
docs.snippet: Prescriptions invites readers to write a better health care parody of "The Night Before Christmas" than the people in Washington seem capable of.

docs.lead_paragraph: For those of you wondering how the current iteration of the Senate's health care legislation would affect family finances, our colleagues over at the Bucks blog have just posted the answers to some frequently asked questions about flexible spending accounts, insurance premium subsidies and, yep, the indoor tanning tax. Read the post at Bucks.

headline.main: The Senate Bill: What's in It for Me?

docs.abstract: How some provisions of the Senate bill would affect family finances.
docs.snippet: How some provisions of the Senate bill would affect family finances.

docs.lead_paragraph: With health care reform legislation near a final vote in the Senate, many consumers may be scratching their heads about what the expected reforms may mean for them, especially with a number of differences still existing between the Senate and House bills.

headline.main: A Health Care Legislation Explainer for Consumers

docs.abstract: A look at how health care reform legislation is likely to impact consumers' wallets.
docs.snippet: A look at how health care reform legislation is likely to impact consumers' wallets.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite the increasing confidence of Senate Democrats that they will pass health care legislation later this week, the American people are still unhappy with Congressional attempts at an overhaul, according to two new polls.

headline.main: Polls: Majority Disapprove of Health Care Legislation

docs.abstract: Two polls find that Americans are still unhappy with Congressional efforts to overhaul the health care system.
docs.snippet: Two polls find that Americans are still unhappy with Congressional efforts to overhaul the health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: After arguing for days about whether Senator Grinch E. Grinch was a Democrat or a Republican, party leaders on Tuesday afternoon announced that they had reached an agreement to save Christmas.

headline.main: Senate Agrees to Morning Vote on Dec. 24

docs.abstract: Senators agree to a morning vote on Christmas Eve, so everyone can then head home ahead of an expected snowstorm.
docs.snippet: Senators agree to a morning vote on Christmas Eve, so everyone can then head home ahead of an expected snowstorm.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study of employee disability claims shows that disabling illnesses and accidents peak after the winter holidays, making it the riskiest time of year for workers in the United States.

headline.main: After the Holidays, More Disability Claims

docs.abstract: Disabling illnesses and accidents peak after the winter holidays, making it the riskiest time of year for American workers, an analysis of employee disability claims shows.
docs.snippet: Disabling illnesses and accidents peak after the winter holidays, making it the riskiest time of year for American workers, an analysis of employee disability claims shows.
